column3: Setup: If you have not done so already, use the premium testdrive to setup for this test at /testdrive/premium
Log in as the publisher account "pdd_premium" as specified by the testdrive result
Go to your account page (Dashboard -> Settings)

Go to the 'Journal CSV' page via the Data menu at the top of the home page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com/docs/journal-csv

column4: There is a page that offers you documentation and information about the Journal CSV

column3:
Click the Download link to download the CSV

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//csv

column4: You are prompted to download a CSV file

column3:
Go to the "Public Data Dump" page via the Data menu at the top of the home page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//docs/public-data-dump

column4: There is a page that offers you documentation and information about the Public Data Dump
There is no way to access the Public Data Dump file from the page

column3:
Go to the journal OAI feed, using the provided link

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//oai?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc

column4: Your are shown an XML document with a list of journal records
The most recent journal (the top one) has a `datestamp` field well within the last 30 days (there will be a journal created on the date that the testdrive ran)

column3:
Go to the article OAI feed, using the provided link

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//oai.article?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc

column4: Your are shown an XML document with a list of article records
The most recent article (the top one) has a `datestamp` field field well within the last 30 days (there will be an article created on the date that the testdrive ran)
